    • Method Detail

      • distance

        public static double distance(Signature signature1,
              Signature signature2,
              double extraMassPenalty)
        This interface is similar to Rubner's interface. See: http://www.cs.duke.edu/~tomasi/software/emd.htm To get the same results as Rubner's code you should set extra_mass_penalty to 0, and divide by the minimum of the sum of the two signature's weights. However, I suggest not to do this as you lose the metric property and more importantly, in my experience the performance is better with emd_hat. for more on the difference between emd and emd_hat, see the paper: A Linear Time Histogram Metric for Improved SIFT Matching Ofir Pele, Michael Werman ECCV 2008 To get shorter running time, set the ground distance function to be a thresholded distance. For example: min(L2, T). Where T is some threshold. Note that the running time is shorter with smaller T values. Note also that thresholding the distance will probably increase accuracy. Finally, a thresholded metric is also a metric. See paper: Fast and Robust Earth Mover's Distances Ofir Pele, Michael Werman ICCV 2009 If you use this code, please cite the papers.
